Package gg.w6.chesslib.model

Class Move

java.lang.Object
gg.w6.chesslib.model.Move
@Immutable public class Move extends Object

This class encapsulates the details of a move on a chessboard, including the origin and destination squares, the type of move (such as normal, castling, en passant, or promotion), and the piece to promote to (if applicable).

This class is immutable and thread-safe. Once constructed, a Move instance cannot be modified.

To obtain a SAN (Standard Algebraic Notation) string for a move, use Moves.generateSAN(Move, Position).

  • Constructor Details

    • Move

      public Move(@NotNull @NotNull Coordinate from, @NotNull @NotNull Coordinate to, @NotNull @NotNull MoveType moveType, @Nullable @Nullable Piece promotionPiece)
      Constructs a new Move object.
      Parameters:
      from - the starting square of the move (must not be null)
      to - the destination square of the move (must not be null). For castling, this is the square the king moves to. For en passant, this is the destination of the capturing pawn.
      moveType - the type of the move (must not be null)
      promotionPiece - the piece the pawn is promoted to, or null if not a promotion. This must only be non-null if moveType == MoveType.PROMOTION.

  • Method Details

    • getFrom

      @NotNull public @NotNull Coordinate getFrom()
      Returns the origin square of the move.
      Returns:
      the starting Coordinate of this move

    • getTo

      @NotNull public @NotNull Coordinate getTo()
      Returns the destination square of the move.

      For castling, this is the square the king moves to. For en passant, this is the square the capturing pawn moves to.

      Returns:
      the ending Coordinate of this move

    • getMoveType

      @NotNull public @NotNull MoveType getMoveType()
      Returns the type of the move.
      Returns:
      the MoveType of this move

    • getPromotionPiece

      @Nullable public @Nullable Piece getPromotionPiece()
      Returns the promotion piece, if this move is a promotion.
      Returns:
      the Piece the pawn is promoted to, or null if not a promotion

    • toString

      @NotNull public @NotNull String toString()
      Returns the move in UCI (Universal Chess Interface) format.

      Examples: e2e4, e7e8q, e1g1. For castling, the king's destination square is used (e.g., e1g1 or e8c8). For en passant, the destination square is the capturing pawnâ€™s landing square.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this move in UCI format

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this move to another object for equality.

      Two moves are considered equal if their origin and destination squares, move type, and promotion piece (if any) are all equal.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object with which to compare to
      Returns:
      true if the objects are equal, false otherwise

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Computes the hash code for this move.

      The hash code is based on the origin square, destination square, move type, and promotion piece (if any).
